lenders.name: James

lenders.name: Lori
lenders.loan_because: A friend at work gave me a Kiva gift certificate for Christmas because of my invlovement in missions work.  What an awesome gift!

lenders.name: Monica S. Flores
lenders.loan_because:
Purpose, intention, and connection. 

We work to support progressive and environmentally sustainable organizations. Our current focus is supporting organic, holistic, fair trade, and green businesses and groups. 

I strongly support women in business, families, and children.

I am constantly seeking ways to increase social entrepreneurship in my life and in the lives of others.
lenders.occupational_info: I help minority women entrepreneurs focus their efforts by using their websites to make more sales, build their community, and connect with their clients.

lenders.name: Charlotte
lenders.loan_because: I can.

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: It brings the world closer to how I envision it.

lenders.name: Steven
lenders.loan_because: I want to help the people of the world achieve the life that they desire to live.
lenders.occupational_info: I work as a banker, lending money to people for homes and businesses.  However, I can't make the decision myself on who to lend to, this allows me to.

lenders.loan_because: We have been blessed.

lenders.name: Bjorn Trygve

Maybe I can help somone, and they help someone, and they help...

lenders.loan_because: I want to help people

lenders.name: Michael
lenders.loan_because: I am a Christian.
lenders.occupational_info: I help people protect their homes and families from illness, fires and natural  disasters.

lenders.name: Chris
lenders.loan_because: it's the right thing to do. I was lucky to be born in the U.S. and given opportunities to succeed. We have a responsibility to help others.

lenders.name: Cort & Twila
lenders.loan_because:
Cort has bad credit because of medical bills--no bank will give me a loan anytime soon. However, I can loan a little bit to others because these are the kind of loans MOST people in the world need.
Twila has good credit and came up with the idea of giving Kiva gift certificates to our mothers--or did Kiva have that idea? At any rate, Twila said: let's make the ladies pay!

lenders.name: John
lenders.loan_because: People around the world need money more than I do.

lenders.name: The Ellison Family
lenders.loan_because: I want everyone to have a chance to succeed. All a person needs is a chance.

lenders.name: Pamelie
lenders.loan_because: I support  the concept of micro-lending and the empowerment and community building that happens.  Its fun to be able to see real faces and stories behind the loans -  it makes the world seem so small and present.  I also want the world to know that there is a lot more compassion in the U.S. than our foreign policies may indicate.  Our country is full of generous, caring people who don't necessarily support the actions of our elected officials.
lenders.occupational_info: Support staff for a progressive consulting firm that specializes in grassroots organizing, targeting, and field work.

lenders.name: Ann Marie
lenders.loan_because: helping others who want to help themselves, truely does inspire me and makes me feel that I can make a small difference
lenders.occupational_info: I work with people living with HIV/AIDS. I offer empowerment workshops to women who are HIV positive as well as work in HIV research in women.

lenders.loan_because: Everyone deserves a chance to improve their lives.
lenders.occupational_info: I live in Seal Beach, California and am the mother of two wonderful children.  I enjoy music, reading, fencing, and working with metal.  I believe that random acts of kindness should be practiced daily.

lenders.name: Kenneth
lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference, and this is the best way for me right now.

lenders.loan_because:
I can, and it's a great way to help a neighbor.  Kiva enables me to be involved in a personal way, and I want to help enable others to reach their goals.  
I like microfinance and this model of individual-based lending because they can help persons' economic and social growth even in the face of enormous institutional and systemic obstacles.

lenders.occupational_info: I help women get clear on what they truly want and take the steps to get it, so they can live the lives they were meant to live!

lenders.name: Melind

KAPU

Brenda - Nurse
Bill - Emergency Management Consultant

lenders.loan_because: I support the idea of microloans. The barriers that were formerly created by a traditional lending arrangement  created a division that kept many bright, beautiful, thoughtful people pigeonholed. I believe that the more you empower people to change their own lives, the better our planet will be.
lenders.occupational_info: I work with at-risk youth in my hometown to better understand resilience as a a result of a supportive community network, rather than the work of an individual.

lenders.name: Sara
lenders.loan_because: I have a degree in economics and I believe in microloans!!!

lenders.loan_because: We all need a little help once in a while!  We are fortunate in the USA, and we must share our good fortune with the rest of the world!
lenders.occupational_info: I create idea's or business that have a demand and that have not been created yet.  We put those ideas into brick & mortar to enable business and living.

lenders.name: Chris
lenders.loan_because: I have a desire to to help with little means to do so. This seemed like something I could do very easily.
lenders.occupational_info: Terrazzo is a flooring where you mix different colors and sizes of marble chips with an epoxy mix and trowel it down and then grind smooth.I also lay tile on walls and floors.

lenders.name: Carla
lenders.loan_because: I saw Kiva introduced on Oprah's show about giving. It touched my heart and I decided to become a Kiva Lender.  I love the idea of helping others to help themselves through business.

From free advertising to viral marketing, from Facebook, Twitter to blogging – Carla can help you move forward with your business.

lenders.name: Rhonda

lenders.occupational_info: I assist in the administrative duties of a pediatrician's office.  It is a rewarding job knowing that I contribute all of my skills and knowledge to ones that are in need.  Helping people is a joyful job and being blessed to work with a wonderful group of people.

lenders.name: Jessica

lenders.occupational_info: I help people see better by providing eye glasses and contact lenses.

lenders.name: Kane

lenders.name: The Harrison Family

I design technology the way a building architect design a house. I make sure the technology is well built so the house will be easy to live in and will not fall down.
My wife does volunteer work at my son's school where he is in second grade.

lenders.name: Kyle@LakelandAerial.com
lenders.loan_because: I give one $25 Kiva.org gift certificate back to the customer, via email, for every $225 they spend at LakelandAerial.com (excluding tax).  During my several semesters abroad and later as a Fulbright scholar I witnessed the vicious cycle of abject poverty, disease, hopelessness, & crime.  I believe in the power of private enterprise to turn this cycle inside-out, so I believe in Kiva.org.
lenders.occupational_info: I shoot photos from light aircraft.  I shoot lakes, businesses, farms, & homes, and market framed aerial photos to the property owners. My work has to be more detailed than satellite photography, which is my primary competition, and cheaper than do-it-yourself aerial photos to make for a compelling value proposition.

lenders.name: Suchi
lenders.loan_because:
Both me and my husband started our Tea Business almost 10 yrs ago.  Getting money from people or friends was not easy when we needed the most. The only solution we and most of other people are left with is going to the banks and you are lucky if you get approved not to mention the amount of time spent on paper work. And if you do and you are all excited till you have to start paying back with big interest on top of what you borrow. So I can totally understand what these people are going through.

KIVA is doing such a wonderful job by lending money with no interest :-) to so many entrepreneurs' all over the world. Moreover its such a small amount which I had no problem coming up with. It costs more than $25 for a couple to go to a movie these days. So why not help someone start their own business and be part of making their dreams come true.
lenders.occupational_info: I own a Tea Business with my husband and am also a professional web designer. Good tea and design keeps me going everyday. Escape today's hectic pace or treat yourself or your favourite tea lover with a nourishing cup of premium quality gourmet teas in beautiful specialty containers. Enter our world of teas.
